website_summaries.verdict: Folds down to a 19-inch length, so it’s a great choice for those who want to use it on the go.
pros: Carbon fiber tripod only weighs 3.4 pounds
Adjustable height range between 19 and 79 inches
Easily handles the load of a heavy DSLR and large lens combination
Can be transformed into a monopod if desired
Ball head will rotate 360 degrees to simplify odd-angle photography
cons: Has some plastic in the ball mount, so it may not last as long as you’d like

customer_reviews.title: There top extends does not hold very well. Pull it up and it falls. Drops for no reason
customer_reviews.text: There top extends does not hold very well. Pull it up and it falls. Drops for no reason. If Iwas not quick, my Sony a7III and my Sony 12-24mm Lens ould have been severely damages. Will be contacting Amazon. This is completely unacceptable. Hopefully, I will get some sort of response from seller
customer_reviews.author: Drone-Techie

customer_reviews.title: Tripod body is light, The Ball-Head is very heavy, overall good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I need light tripod for long hiking & photo shooting. I wish the Ball-head weight could be lighter. I found this tripod is heavier then my other 2 aluminium tripods, all because the weight come from the Ball-head. The Tripod body is light & I love the quality & height. It's worth to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: CCD

customer_reviews.title: Fits and exceeds the needs.
customer_reviews.text: The Geekoto 79 inch is now and integral part of the astronomy set up. The quality of the tripod, the weight capacity and the ease of operation make this tripod a constant companion with the telescopes. The tripod will be used for the 25 X 100 binoculars. This seems to be the one tripod that can fill many roles in the observation and picture taking. It will fit that role by the carbon fiber construction and solid locks for the legs and the 360 degree head. Super good work Geekoto. The removable monopod serves as a quick portable platform for the 25 X 100 binocular. Exceptional product for the money. Recommend the product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: SnoopGrampyGramps

customer_reviews.title: Living with the shakes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a something I can throw in the trunk for use with a spotting scope so it's handy all the time, or as a backup unit for a light weight camera setup. It's a decent unit value-wise but the stability is marginal at best. While it can hold the weight of a 85mm Kowa scope (if you balance it properly), if there is any sort of breeze you're going to be disappointed and struggling with the shakes. And no, I would not trust this to my Canon 5D. This will be OK in a pinch and used with care, but for any serious use, I'll stick with my Manfrotto 475B or at least a 055.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but I dislike the tightening knobs on the legs.
customer_reviews.text: It takes some minutes to set up, because the knobs need to be tightened. Leave one less than perfect (and there are 9) and that leg sinks and can cause a fall for your expensive camera. I have learned to double check the tightness at every set up. I would not buy it again for that reason, as I prefer the quicker clamps to secure.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Excellent travel tripod
customer_reviews.text: We just completed a 2 week trip to the Atacama desert and Bolivian salt flats. Tons of breathtaking scenery that would have been difficult or impossible to photograph without a good tripod. This tripod lived up to it's claims. Lightweight enough for travel (we were on the move the whole trip - planes, jeeps, cable cars, hikes, you name it). Tough enough to handle the travel with no signs of wear. Steady enough (with the help of the camera bag hooked to the bottom for added weight) to allow night photography in mild to moderate wind, adaptable enough to use effectively as a monopod and macro-tripod as well as a traditional tripod. Definitely a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bhatt

customer_reviews.title: Not the smallest or lightest, but excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I almost went with a Manfrotto for over twice the price and the same general dimensions and weight. I'm glad I bought this; I can't imagine anything better for the weight. I'm not nuts about the adapter in that it doesn't snap into place like previous versions but I'll get used to it. The ball head adjustment is also a bit tricky, also just a learning curve for me, but challenging with a DSLR and 300 lens. But once it's in place, it is very steady. I like the monopod feature, and it feels very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: The price is right but the camera plate needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest making it compatible with the Manfrotto plates. The issue is that my camera kept becoming loose (in particular because I needed to move the tripod around a lot.) And I tried both geekoto tripods so the issue wasn't just a dud plate. If geekoto can just make it compatible with Manfrotto plates (or somehow engineer their own great plates, I suppose) -- this would be the best affordable tripod on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Great potential but heavy components
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a versatile, light weight, tripod and this looked very promising. The build is ok but my main issue was the components of it are a little lower quality and very heavy. So even though, this is a carbon tripod, it was heavier than the regular one i am replacing it with. If it had better components and lighter attached to the carbon body, then i would have given it a perfect score. Clearly this is priced much lower than competition so that must be mentioned. Don't expect a ferrari when you are paying for a civic.
customer_reviews.author: Saman

customer_reviews.title: Built great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my Nikon D850 and 70-200 2.8. This is a pretty heavy combo, and this tripod holds her steady as a rock. The build quality is great, the fit and finish is top-notch! My buddy has a $700 Gitzo, and after inspecting mine, he was second-guessing himself on paying so much for his. Is this the same quality as a $700 Gitzo...no. However it is a great tripod and I trust it to hold my $4500 worth of gear with no worries. If your on a budget like me, then look no further!
customer_reviews.author: jovial

customer_reviews.title: Monopod Screw Thread is Faulty. NOT USABLE - SEE VIDEO
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give it a zero star but can't, just got this brand new today. I was trying out all functionalities of the tripod, tried to unscrew and use the monopod. when tried to put the monopod leg back, it kept on slipping on the threads. tried different ways but it does not screw. Please see the video and decide. Can you imagine this happening, when you are out on a shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Sneha

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality. Looks cool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice tripod. the build appear to be pretty solid. It also looks really good (received compliments already). The star deduction is due to the extended time needed to breakout the monopod and the ease of folding it back up to store it. The monopod steps are too involved and cannot easily be done during an event or day trip. I will have to continue carrying my other monopod instead. The folding process can sometimes pinch your fingers. The inversion of the legs is also awkward. I can live with these but will hope the designer will take this feedback into future designs.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burkett

customer_reviews.title: I bought a second one!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two! This is a very sturdy tripod with a very functional ball head and secure shoe plate. The product came packaged beautifully - like a new IPhone. It is a great first impression of the pride in manufacturing. I'm over 6' and I can stand with the tripod at eye level and above. I haven't yet used the monopod included in the device. Nor have I positioned the tripod in any position but landscape. But I know if I want to contort the tripod to accommodate a view - I can do it. Tip - take the time to register the product at geekoto.com. They are responsive and discounts can be had.
customer_reviews.author: euroclark

customer_reviews.title: Superior tripod
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tripod because of the carbon fiber construction that would support approximately 27 pounds, and it extends to approximately 79 inches. I have used it for several months, and I am extremely satisfied with the construction and stability. The ball head is really stable being made from metal. The entire head moves smoothly and locks down tightly forming a rigid unit. Over all I can not find a feature I would change. It listed as a light 3.4 pounds, I would not classify it as light, but as medium weight tripod. Otherwise, if you need a strong, stable tripod, you need to consider this product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Glassbrenner

customer_reviews.title: Very nice piece of equipment. A bit heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Because it seems so well-made, I’ll resist the temptation to dock it a star for its weight. With the carry-case, it comes in a little over 4 pounds. By itself, you’re still look at 3 lbs 6 oz. I was hoping a carbon fiber tripod would save more weight, but in fairness, the product page accurately stated 3.4 pounds. Was favorably impressed by the solidity of the monopod/hiking stock. Because of the way it stores, it will readily lend itself to adding a a leather hand grip. Definitely happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great for carrying around, especially for price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for an international trip that got sidelined (thanks, COVID). I've taken it out though (made sure it had its mask on at all times), and the stability does not match a heavier tripod; I did not expect it to. Love its versatility, weight, and performance. Just understand that the weight loss necessitates some compromises; it's easy, though, to compensate for all but the most extreme cases. I've used it for a crop DSLR with medium zoom pro-level (somewhat weighty) lens.
customer_reviews.author: P. Caskey

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight tripod!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tripod for just about anything you can imagine.bits very light, so portability is high. The detachable monopod is a great addition. For landscape photography it's a solid option. While it is a bit light for shooting in high winds, the portability is hard to beat. Great value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: slickeyboy

customer_reviews.title: This is (was) a really nice tripod regardless of price. *UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely stellar performer for Nikon Z7. A bigger rig may need a larger tripod but for mirrorless or small-mid size DSLRs this will be hard to beat. The ballhead is way nicer than the far more expensive one I've been using. **So just a quick update. I absolutely loved this tripod. So much so I bought a second one. Unfortunately both have since had failures in the twist locks on the leg sections. There appears to be a plastic C ring that has snapped which renders the tripod pretty much useless. The Ball-heads are still performing well enough that will just get some decent legs
customer_reviews.author: Guy Coniglio

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Had this for two months. The twist/screw tighten legs don't stay tight. Constantly having to re-tighten the legs/other used connections. It finally just broke. The piece that holds the ball head is glued into the supporting piece and broke; now head won't stay on.
customer_reviews.author: aljarn

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT TRIPOD!
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews like most people and found that the GEEKOTO 79 was rated highest. I am tall so I want a sturdy tripod that retains stability even when I have it ratcheted up to eye level. Out of the box this tripod is fantastic. Strong even at extended length, screw-tensioners hold as they should, and the ball bearing platform makes it a breeze to shoot with. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: MagnusDunning

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great solid Tripod it’s very light in weight but yet can handle a heavy dslr camera.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Gamino

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod for the money
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had much chance to use it yet, but so far so good. It is a big step up in stability, ease of use, versatility from my old tripod. The design and features are well thought out. The only knock is it seems a bit heavier than expected
customer_reviews.author: dgsouth

customer_reviews.title: Every bit as good as a Gitzo or Manfrotto at half the price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this tripod for a year now, everywhere from sea to mountain top, salt and freshwater, jungle to forest, zero to 96 degrees, rain or shine. Every bit as good as a Gitzo or Manfrotto CF tripod at half the price tag. Save your $ and get this one. It’s a great tripod.
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Williams

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Geeokoto's customer service is solid. They saw my review, reached out, and refunded my purchase. As I was undeniably out of the warranty period, I am very appreciative that they would take this kind of initiative. Thank you! This tripod lasted exactly one month longer than the product support window. The glue that holds one of the leg sections in place gave way, and now the tripod is basically useless. I knew that for the price, I wasn't buying a Manfrotto or Gitzo - but I barely used this thing before it gave up on me. Spend a little more money on something that will last at least one dozen outings before falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Danner

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but support is bad
customer_reviews.text: Tripod worked great and is light weight, had an issue with one of the leg mounts breaking, contacted support and was asked to send in pictures. I sent everything requested and never heard back from support.
customer_reviews.author: Keyth Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy and tough
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tripod I have ever used. I took it back packing across yellowstone, is very light weight. Fast and easy to set up. The mono pod is kind of a pain to use as you kind of have to take the tri pod apart to do it. I found that it was just as easy to fold the tripod legs in and use it like that. I used it for a wedding a couple weeks ago and it was perfect, I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Hubcap

customer_reviews.title: Buyers Beware
customer_reviews.text: Normally I don’t write reviews, but this time I thought it was important to share that you need to be careful with the legs when collapsing them! Maybe it’s just because I’m still new to photography and didn’t know any better, but do not collapse the legs together and then unlock the legs to slide them into one another for stowage. The plastic shims inside will brea, and as far as I know Geekoto does not offer repair kits or replacement parts because I haven’t found any. Nonetheless, it is a good tripod, but I wish I could get some replacement shims that are meant for this tripod!
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: A Lightweight but sturdy, multi-functional tripod!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I didn't expect is that it is as red as it is. It looked more bronze in the photos - obviously, no effect on function. It's light, but fairly strong and packs up medium small. I did glance at the instructions, but setup and use are reasonably intuitive and the mono pod leg is well marked. Not sure if I could trust my heaviest lens/camera combinations, but haven't tried them all yet. Overall, I'm very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Willis Sellars

customer_reviews.title: Definitely better than other chinese simillar looking tripods
customer_reviews.text: I ordered that one for 125 and another very simmilar looking one for 70 or so. While the differences are subtle I, hands down, desided to stick to that one. Feet stoppers seems reliable, the head is pretty good quality, darn tall. Comes with some sort of useless bag. It also has wierd special 2 inch extention which nobody in their right mind would ever consider using, but it is there. This is what makes it 79 inch insted of 77. The level buble is unreliable at best. Still like the tripod. It tripods pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Kunde

customer_reviews.title: Light weight plus price
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod. I have a heavy Manfrotto aluminum tripod and wanted a lightweight carbon fiber tripod. This one fits the bill precisely. Light weight, good height, stability and all for a great price. Love it. One minor con: I don't like the quick release. Not as easy or precise as the Manfrotto but for the price . . .
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Tall and light
customer_reviews.text: Tall, light, sturdy. I've used a Mefoto Roadtrip for 5 years. This one is lighter and taller than the roadtrip. The weight does make a difference. The only thing I would like to see to make this a 5 star tripod would be to add a tension knob to the ball head for heavier camera setups. That would also add more to the price, but would be nice to have the option. All and all a really nice tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Salomon Pena

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: as a pro there is nothing to dislike about this unit. its sturdy, stable and lightweight. I mounted my heaviest gear on it my D810, nikon 80-200 2.8 two ring all steel lens and a grip. took it to the local reservoir and used it in studio. highly recommend this unit. your gear will be safe on top of this unit. and it has nice aesthetics. stop reading and buy it you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: michael cano

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tripod for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I'm not sure you can come close to a better tripod. I searched for a long time, but couldn't convince myself I was ready to spend several hundred dollars on a tripod, not also didn't want something cheap that wouldn't last. I came across the geekoto and was impressed by the quality for the cost. It's not the lightest or most compact tripod on the market, but for something similar, I'd expect to pay a couple hundred more.
customer_reviews.author: Fish Fam

customer_reviews.title: I love this tripod.
customer_reviews.text: The carbon fiber is amazing, strong and very light. Should last the rest of my life. The alloy metal parts are colored a real pretty burgundy red. Everything adjusts smoothly and just where I want it. Wasn't sure what the hook was for, so they sent me a picture. Good for keeping the bag off the ground and/or providing ballast on windy days. Clever. Received excellent and quick support from CS rep. All in all, very happy with this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Lariet442

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and it will do the job.
customer_reviews.text: This is a backup tripod I purchased specifically for a trip. Don't quite know if I love it or not. It is light, no question about it. It is well constructed but the lowest extensions seem a bit flimsy. It was an excellent buy and I will take it on a safari later this year.
customer_reviews.author: HLA

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and sturdy:  A best buy
customer_reviews.text: I use mine to hold my Labradar chronograph and my Swarovski 85mm spotter . Its exceptionally sturdy and stands up well to muzzleblast from large powder capacity cartridges. Its also light enough to pack. It provides a stable platform for my spotting scope when I'm standing. All-in-all its a best buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Huntaria

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very good tripod at a very competitive price. I haven't use it for a very long time but so far it is very easy to set up and take down, which for me is important. I realized that went I have to fumble with a piece of gear I tend to leave it at home more often than not. It is solid and stable enough for my need. So far I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dey17

customer_reviews.title: This is cheaply build
customer_reviews.text: And not stable at all ... heavier than I expected... Do not recommended
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality craftsmenship, can be unstable if not set up correctly.
customer_reviews.text: I see other setups in photos and want to cringe. When you use this tripod, make sure you are extending all three legs, all the way first before raising the middle neck, it becomes terribly unbalanced, if you don't extend legs first and just do the neck. Also if you have a heavier setup you must use weight like back pack hanging from center so that it is more stable. While it is strong and rated at 26lbs. it is also very light, which can be unstable.
customer_reviews.author: JHN

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this tripod! For the price range, it is the best I've seen. I love that it extends really tall. It's really solid and sturdy, yet still fairly lightweight. It folds down really small. The ball mount works great. It's good workmanship and made of good materials––not cheap crap like lower end tripods. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Todd T. Young

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I love this tripod! I was looking at a name brand tripod that was much shorter than this one and cost more than double. Having tried the name brand one and now owning this one I can’t figure out why the other costs so much. This is a great tripod for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony wade

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod and customer service
customer_reviews.text: The tripod worked great till my last shoot. One of the legs started sticking and wouldn’t retract. I contacted Geekoto and asked for a a replacement section for the leg that as sticking. When I got home yesterday there was a new tripod on the porch. They sent a complete new tripod. Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Mitchem

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Light for Back Country Use
customer_reviews.text: Used this light tripod for hunting in the high country and open plain. It is perfect for spotting scope/binocular. Also used it for shooting from the prone, sitting and/or standing. Since prone position is not always practical, this tripod comes in handy to allow shooting from the sitting or standing position. It will easily hold a 13 lbs rifle steady out to 600 yards shooting from a sitting position with arca swiss attached to the rifle. For precision shooting, a larger, more sturdy tripod, will be required but this one works great when covering lots of ground.
customer_reviews.author: jay vue

customer_reviews.title: Overall a very good tripod
customer_reviews.text: This is a solidly constructed tripod with many features. I like it a lot. My only wish is for a better instruction manual. There are a couple of parts that are included but the manual doesn't tell you what they are for. Other than that it's a very good tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Jack D.

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod so far
customer_reviews.text: Very nice so far, seems strudy and tall enough for what I wanted, ajusts easily and locks my spotting scope where I want it with out a lot of difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Baker

customer_reviews.title: Most features for the best price.
customer_reviews.text: Hobbyists photographer. I am satisfied with this purchase. $150 is a good price for what you get in this camera stand. You get higher end material and multiple camera angles with the ball head. Best value for the number of features this Geekoto tripod offers.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan C. Bunnell

customer_reviews.title: The base that attaches to the camera keeps coming loose. It will not stay tight.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a chance to use the Geekoto 79 Carbon Fiber Tropod. It would be great if the base that goes on the camera did not keep coming loose and that makes the camera unstable. They really need to fix the problem and it would be good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a sturdy tripod for my camera with large zoom lens. This one is very sturdy and doesn't feel like it's going to tip at all. The dials are easy to use, the adjustable head makes for quick changes. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: wannarun4life

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very pleased with this tripod! I was in the market for a reasonably priced full sized carbon fiber tripod that would be able to fit in my bag and not add to much weight for my hiking requirements. It a little longer then I had hoped but makes up for length in how easy it is to use. I was pleased to find it was able to handle the weight of my largest lens. And very happy about how quickly you can invert it to get really low for shots close to the ground. So far I’m very happy and will consider Geekoto for other gear needs!
customer_reviews.author: Journé

customer_reviews.title: Nice tripod!  Shipping packaging questionable.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this tripod in one portrait shoot so far (just received it recently), and it's nice and sturdy, and versatile given its height and leg adjustments. That being said, the metal clip used to adjust the leg angles is a touch finicky, but the tripod was still very stable. I didn't love how the tripod was shipped just in its packaging, and not in another box - the packaging was pretty much opened when it arrived (likely from being banged around in shipping), and the tripod could've fallen out during shipping, or been stolen. Otherwise, I'm happy with this tripod overall!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for stability but....
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by the weight , i was wandering was a bit more stable , with a bit of wind you have enought vibrations not to get good pictures with long exposute and i realized i had the same problem without wind with long exposure when the camera shoot .
customer_reviews.author: Gianluca Steffenini

customer_reviews.title: Great Tripod
customer_reviews.text: Armature photographer here and I wanted one versatile tripod. This one definitely does not disappoint. It does everything the advertising information says and does it very well. Many others have talked about specific details in their reviews and these are easily found. But for my general use it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and lightweight but strong and stable enough to hold my Sony 200-600 zoom steady. So far the only drawback is that to use the monopod you have to carry an extra screw and put it on - minor inconvenience but just another thing you have to keep track of.
customer_reviews.author: GO

customer_reviews.title: Hold ups great!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently ordered the GEEKOTO 79 inches Carbon Fiber Camera Tripod, this tripod is light weight fits in my bag without adding so much extra weight. I used it this past weekend out at the beach shooting fireworks for the 4th of July and it was holding up against the windy conditions without any problems,. One of my favorite features is the 360° Flexible sphere design which lets me take panoramic pictures with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Hilario

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: I've been enjoying this tripod since I purchased it. It is light and has a narrow profile when folded up. This makes for an easy fit into side pockets on my pack. The best part is that the legs can be taken completely apart and cleaned. This is a handy feature for landscape photography because I can clear the beach sand, dirt or other debris and keep it working properly. I use a little bit of gun oil on the threads after cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tripod/Monopod
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tripod they carry, I have all three tripods and this is now my second Carbon. I am constantly using tripods in the ocean and in rough terrain. This is a great tripod that I would recommend for Landscape photography, and utilizing the interchangeable Monopod for Sports, Birds, and or Nature photos. Stable, lightweight, holds my 200mm well and a 600mm, Monopod comes in handy, and tripod also transforms to allow a super low angle without the middle piece getting in the way.
customer_reviews.author: T. Pompeo

customer_reviews.title: Geekoto Tripod rocks!!!
customer_reviews.text: So I'm rebuilding my photo studio and upgrading my equipment. I've never owned a carbon fiber tripod before, so this is my first one. I received my tripod in the mail on Christmas eve and had a blast playing around with it the next day. When you hold onto this tripod, you are definitely holding a quality product. From the foam grip for the monopod to the feet, I felt confident in securing my camera as I was photographing in the park. No more cheap plastic tripods for me! Now I need to look into studio strobes... hmmmm ;) (Geekoto also offers lighting equipment as well!)
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: The ct25 pro Craftsman -What a great tripod!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this tripod a little over a month a go I got to say that I love it. It is light weight very easy to take portrait and then convert to a landscape position pictures or video. So here are some of the things you could use this tripod as 1. A monopod 2 the tripod legs back fold so if you want you could take inside down picture or take low to the grown shots 3. 360 panning scale which is cool if you want to take video of a full room. Wow I could go on but I will not it's a great lightweight tripod that gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: jay v

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Tripod
customer_reviews.text: Perfect upgrade. Stable and great on dampening vibrations on my current camera tested it against my old one and moved around it hopped a time or two in long exposure and the older tripod had some blur in the distance picture frames while the Geekoto held fine. The only negative thing I can say is how the bubble level gets obstructed by the camera... so I bought a bubble level for the hot shoe and now it’s all good. Recommended all the way. Deploying is fast and streamline. Do not hesitate!!
customer_reviews.author: cody Pafford

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a solid support so far
customer_reviews.text: I like the tripod overall but think that there should be set screws to lock the head in place as I have on all of the other tripods that I have had. It seems that the head could loosen up easily. Otherwise it seems to be a good solid unit with many options for setup. It is also high enough for me at 5' 9" without the center post extended to look through the lens without a lot of bending over.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P

customer_reviews.title: Impressive device
customer_reviews.text: This is a very impressive and lightweight tripod, versatile enough for most possible use cases. Holds full 10lb tele setup while doing cinematic smooth rotation with absolutely no problems. should have bought long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: John Doppelganger

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod, tremendous value at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: I'm really loving this tripod. I'm over 6 feet tall and I need a tripod that can reach my eye level and be stable enough for landscape and long exposure photography. This tripod is light, durable, and stable. It easily holds my Nikon D750 and has a hook to hold my camera bag. So far it's meeting my needs and exceeding my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Noone

customer_reviews.title: Solid tripod for photography
customer_reviews.text: I had originally purchased a really cheap tripod and immediately regreted the decision. Hunting for an upgrade, I found this one. I'm extremely happy with the purchase. It's lightweight and solid with a super convenient ball mounting head for easy, fine adjustment. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Nice versatile light-weight tripod
customer_reviews.text: Got this tripod a week ago, and gotta say I'm a fan. I had another Geekoto tripod before this and that one was pretty good, but this one seems to be even lighter in weight, without losing any stability. I also especially like how easy it is to extend and retract the legs. The twist to lock and unlock tends to be a lot faster then the clips in my experience, and when I'm shooting a great sunset, every second matters. Give this tripod a try, you definitely won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Haveran

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: It works just as advertised. It appears to be build to last, time will tell for sure. So far, my only beef is the ball socket on the head is slightly sticky but with the weight of a full0-size DSLR it's fairly smooth. I love the self-contained monopod and the flexibility of the unit makes it more of a value. Overall weight is good. The head actually adds a significant portion of the mass.
customer_reviews.author: John Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: Great Tripod. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on different tripods and ultimately decided to get the carbon fiber version of this one. After about five months I absolutely love it! It is lightweight and compact, which is really helpful when taking around filming my sons sporting events. It’s smooth and very easy to use. I have a highly recommend this tripod.
customer_reviews.author: TwoWas

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made, light tripod
customer_reviews.text: Very compact, precisely made and sets up quickly. The only downside of the light weight is that if you are in a windy situation you probably should hang some weight on the hook provided for max. stability. Also, if you do a lot with a high camera position, the maximum height on this is achieved by extending the center column, so it's not as rigid then.
customer_reviews.author: Swanscove

customer_reviews.title: Carbon fiber and twist extensions... love it!
customer_reviews.text: When looking into tripods for glassing during my hunts, most hunting companies charge an arm and a leg. I saw this tripod and thought I’d give it a shot. I loved how it was carbon fiber and it was a twist extension. The head on it is super smooth and seems really well made! I mainly use this tripod for my 10X42 Swarovski EL range binos. Soon I’ll put a spotting scope on it. I don’t see that being a problem. I haven’t used it in the field yet. Hoping to use it soon! I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Boa Constrictor

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, sturdy and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and not expensive travel tripod. My first impression was amazing. It’s very light and sturdy. Final finishes are amazing. Definitely worth trying.
customer_reviews.author: Nenad Spasojevic

customer_reviews.title: Really nice looking and seems like it will last
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a really nice quality. The packaging is nice. I have only used it once but it heals my d750 and extended battery and large lens just fine. Glad I got the carbon cause it's just sexy to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Jdg

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love this tripod! It is very sturdy, easy to set up, and a nice light weight. I am looking forward to doing some travelling with it. A nice feature to add would be to include a small zipper bag with a carabiner for attaching that could hold the accessory short center tube and coupling screw. I am going to be looking for a bag I can store these in so they do not get lost. Also, retractable spikes on the rubber feet would be nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: CO Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Light weight & easy to use & great experience
customer_reviews.text: I just bought the tripod a week ago and so happy with it right away! My friend and I went shooting&vlogging all around Los Angeles and that was a great experience! If you need something that's light and easy convertible for photography, videography or vlogging this is it. It can be used as a monopod, which is so cool as well. I personally love a design too, color code is awesome, totally fits my style. It goes with a bag which is great, you can easily bring it everywhere. Would def love to check more products from the brand in a future. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best lightweight Tripod
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing tripod. I took this tripod to my trip to Colorado and shot some star trails. The results were amazing. I have posted the photo which I took using this Tripod. This tripod is easy to carry and fitted inside my carry-on baggage. It's a must buy if you prefer lightweight tripod during traveling. I used Nikon D750 and Nikon 14-24mm, tripod was very stable. I totally love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mahe

customer_reviews.title: The perfect Tripod
customer_reviews.text: I love this tripod for its stability , light weight and the easy use. No complaints just but it. Although I made a mistake of dropping them down 15 ft breaking the quick release 😕
customer_reviews.author: Vishnu P.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tripod with a carry case that is very convenient for those that love to up and go places.
customer_reviews.text: We love this tripod. It is so easy to use and very convenient for packing up and taking it with you. It feels sturdy and strong. It comes in a nice carry case. We love the monopod and how easy it is to take apart and put back together. Definitely reccomend this tripod!
customer_reviews.author: Flyhighaerial

customer_reviews.title: This is such a great price for such a dynamic piece of equipment, I DEFINITELY recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I really love and appreciate the fast delivery time and everything came complete. I ABSOLUTELY love the tripod! I use it for filming purposes and it works more than great! It has some nice weight to it and holds a pretty heavy rig. The monopod really comes I'm handy for some cool shots and double as a boom-mic pole. This is such a great price for such a dynamic piece of equipment, I DEFINITELY recommend getting one!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrie Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Love my tripod!
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is great and very versatile. It's sturdy but light. I love that it has ring clamps on the legs, instead of flip-open tabs that can break off. The legs are adjustable at several angles. It was a little confusing at first because the legs close by folding up (which does help protect the head of the tripod in storage).
customer_reviews.author: ShawnF

customer_reviews.title: Best tripod in the game
customer_reviews.text: After using this tripod for a few month I gotta say, it’s the best tripod I’ve ever used. It’s light, portable and has a very solid built!
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I give this camera stand 5 stars. Very easy to work with straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Good, lightweight tripod
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and quite stable for a travel tripod. Its light weight enough that I don't mind carrying it around, when I would leave a heavier one behind.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: High quality and light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a light stand when travel. It's tall enough to do the job and light for easy packing in a suite case.
customer_reviews.author: Young

customer_reviews.title: Quality and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worth every penny. The panning head is very sturdy and holds a camera with a 300mm lens very well in a locked position. Very nice height of the tripod.
customer_reviews.author: amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: Real nice low price end Tripod/Monopod
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this tripod. I studied a lot of reviews and price points, and this tripod fit the bill. I do not use tripods a lot but I wanted a tripod that was sturdy with my Nikon 200-500 and yet light weight, with a monopod. This worked with all aspects. Seems like good quality and very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: ALAN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Considering the purchase price, this tripod is great in its construction and material quality. All parts operate well, setup is a breeze. Very light weight, which makes it great for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: officerbrad

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews of this product and saw the positivity being expressed and felt safe buying this product. After buying this product and receiving it I can say that it lived up to my expectations. You cant beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They don't honor there warrenty.
customer_reviews.text: I had plastic tab on leg break making it impossible to lock leg. This happened after 2nd use. Contacted company and they said they would replace it with a new one. It's been 6 months and no replacement. So if you purchase this tripod don't expect them to honor warranty.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN STUHLMAN

customer_reviews.title: Best tripod for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I bought this tripod but it turned out perfect for my needs!! I can't see paying anywhere from $300 towellover $1000!fr a tripod when this one is perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby lynn

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a travel tripod and it has worked out great. It doubles as a monopod for the places that do not allow you to bring a tripod but you need added stability. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff C. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tripod!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in the studio and on location. It's a great tripod. I hang my backpack off of it for greater stability.
customer_reviews.author: michaeljwilliams

customer_reviews.title: High quality construction though  light weight
customer_reviews.text: Very light for its capacity. Very versatile. Incorporates an intrinsic monopod ( a removable leg you can attach the tripod head to).
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Super strong.
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely on the heavy side. I was impressed by the strength of this thing. Built like an absolute tank though.
customer_reviews.author: NOYB

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Great Ball Head, Compact Design
customer_reviews.text: Give a a solid, sturdy tripod with a very sound ball head. It is compact and relatively light. It is a good balance between weight, size and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald P. Word

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but solid at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I hike a lot with my fairly heavy Canon DSLR with a heavy and awkward telephoto zoom lens. This tripod saves me nearly a full pound of weight over my old one with no loss of stability. The quality for the price puts it in a league of its own.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Wetherell

customer_reviews.title: Solid tripod
customer_reviews.text: Been enjoying this tripod so far. Build quality seems solid. It’s fairly lightweight, which is nice and still held sturdy while shooting at the windy golden gate. The ball joint head makes it easy to change angles quickly and it’s nice to be able to switch to monopod really easily as needed as well. The aesthetics of the tripod are also a nice bonus. Great tripod for the price! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Resh A Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Tripod
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is everything I expected it to be. Light, sturdy, and easy to use at any angle.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, very sturdy, and great looks. This is a very affordable premium product. It's very versatile, and can be used as a monopoly as well. Operation is smooth and easy. Seriously, this is a great tripod!
customer_reviews.author: BlindArchangel

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this tripod once so far, but it seems to be very stable and easy to carry...being so lightweight. I also like the number of adjustable features, that allows you to get the perfect platform in any condition.
customer_reviews.author: Omari

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive to have to worry about it coming apart
customer_reviews.text: Am a hiker and had my tripod strapped to my backpack and the leg unscrewed its self along the way and fell off after only my second time using it, making it a very big waste for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Too light weight
customer_reviews.text: I guess that comes with the lightweight but the legs fully extended tend to be a little shaky
customer_reviews.author: Juan Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: At less than $150 for a carbon fiber tripod, INCLUDING a ball head, this is a great deal. It also converts to a monopod. Time will tell if this will be durable, but it seems sable enough for my > 5lbs of camera and lens.
customer_reviews.author: Ivypandas

product_meta.title: GEEKOTO 79 inches Carbon Fiber Camera Tripod Monopod with 360 Degree Ball Head 1/4 inch Quick Shoe Plate Professional Tripod Load up to 26.5 pounds
feature_bullets: Carbon fiber: high-density carbon fiber, with good stability and light weight
360° ball head: The ball head can rotate 360° make it shooting around 360° and with horizontal bubbles, and a scale

Adjustable and expandable: the legs of the tripod have 3 adjustable triggers and retractable ring buckles, which can be adjusted to different placemMulti-function: not only can be combined into a monopod, can be used as a trekking pole, but also can be upside down for low-angle shooting!ent positions and different shooting heights
Multi-function: not only can be combined into a monopod, can be used as a trekking pole, but also can be upside down for low-angle shooting!
Special design:ball head with 1/4 inches Quick -release plate,suitable for camera with 1/4 inches screw holes . weight hook for add stablity on the uneven ground
